snippet: The Cubs, like the Dodgers, have watched their top two starters fall short against the Mets in the postseason, while the Mets have shown how deep their own rotation is.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds Chicago Cubs should be more concerned with New York Mets formidable pitching rotation than with curse of billy goat as they head to Wrigley Field for Game 3 of National League Championship Series, which they trail two games to none.
lead_paragraph: The Cubs, like the Dodgers, have watched their top two starters fall short against the Mets in the postseason, while the Mets have shown how deep their own rotation is.

headline.print_headline: If Anything Curses the Cubs This Year, It May Be the Mets’ Rotation
headline.main: If Anything Curses the Cubs This Year, It May Be the Mets’ Rotation
